page.title: 06Cameley Manor
page.content: After the Conquest the Bishop of Coutances took the manor over from two thanes.In 1143 Alexander de Alno (or Dalneto) sold the manor to the monks of Bath Priory,who held it until 1483. Dando is a local place and family name and could be a corruption of 'de Alno'. Following the Dissolution the manor passed into the hands of the Vaughn family.John Hippisley of Ston Easton bought the manor in 1561.His descendants still hold the title,and while no longer landowners the family is still patron of Cameley parish. A ruined farmhouse near Cameley church now marks the site of the manor house.
